case_description: ABC Manufacturing Company withheld salaries of 50 employees for 4 months citing financial losses during COVID-19 pandemic. Employees filed a complaint under Payment of Wages Act, 1936. Company claims force majeure and argues the delay was beyond their control due to lockdown restrictions and supply chain disruptions.
legal_question: Are employees entitled to full salary payment and compensation when employer withholds wages due to pandemic-related financial difficulties? What remedies are available under Payment of Wages Act, 1936?
